response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age and Gender", "medium", "At 21 years old and male, the individual is in a demographic statistically associated with higher rates of recidivism, although age can sometimes be a protective factor as maturity increases."],
    ["Race", "medium", "Identifying as Black has been correlated with systemic challenges that may indirectly affect recidivism risk, though it should be interpreted with caution."],
    ["Arrest History", "medium", "One prior arrest, even without conviction, indicates some contact with the justice system which may elevate risk moderately."],
    ["Marital and Living Status", "medium", "Never married and currently living alone may limit social support, which is a factor that can influence recidivism risk."],
    ["Employment", "medium", "Holding only one job during the past year suggests potential instability or challenges in securing consistent employment, which is linked to recidivism risk."],
    ["Education", "low", "Having a high school diploma is a basic educational achievement, providing some level of stability and lower recidivism risk compared to lower education levels."],
    ["Substance Use", "low", "Lack of recent drug use reduces one of the significant risk factors for criminal behavior and recidivism."],
    ["Mental Health", "medium", "Experiencing depressive symptoms on some occasions can be a risk factor, as mental health issues are associated with higher recidivism if not managed."],
    ["Family and Upbringing", "medium", "Growing up in an urban household with a moderate family size may reflect exposure to community risk factors that can predispose an individual to recidivism."],
    ["Religious Belief", "low", "Belief in a higher power can serve as a protective factor by offering social support and a framework for personal accountability."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: At 21 years old and male, the individual is in a demographic statistically associated with higher rates of recidivism, although age can sometimes be a protective factor as maturity increases.
Identifying as Black has been correlated with systemic challenges that may indirectly affect recidivism risk, though it should be interpreted with caution.
One prior arrest, even without conviction, indicates some contact with the justice system which may elevate risk moderately.
Never married and currently living alone may limit social support, which is a factor that can influence recidivism risk.
Holding only one job during the past year suggests potential instability or challenges in securing consistent employment, which is linked to recidivism risk.
Having a high school diploma is a basic educational achievement, providing some level of stability and lower recidivism risk compared to lower education levels.
Lack of recent drug use reduces one of the significant risk factors for criminal behavior and recidivism.
Experiencing depressive symptoms on some occasions can be a risk factor, as mental health issues are associated with higher recidivism if not managed.
Growing up in an urban household with a moderate family size may reflect exposure to community risk factors that can predispose an individual to recidivism.
Belief in a higher power can serve as a protective factor by offering social support and a framework for personal accountability.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 6 feet 0 inches. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 5, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
